itemDescription: British writer, actor, musician and screenwriter (1908-1982)

wikipedia_page.main: Francis Baker (22 May 1908 – 1982) was a British author of novels and short stories, mainly on fantastic or supernatural themes. He was also an actor, musician and television scriptwriter. His best-known works are his novels, The Birds (1936) and Miss Hargreaves (1940), and his memoir, I Follow But Myself (1968).
